info.title: NBA Mobile Stats Feed
info.description:
The NBA Mobile Stats Feed is an open API for accessing both live-game stats content -- box scores, play-by-play, scoreboards, roster lineups -- and non-live-game content -- schedules, rosters, player and team information, stat leaders, etc. Live-game content is generated during games that are in progress and is updated with each game event that is captured in the arena. Post-game, the live-game content reflects the final state of the game data. The page you are viewing provides a developer portal for this feed, with documentation on the various resources available from this feed, the schemas in which the data of those resources are structured, and a means for retrieving actual data to foster familiarity with what the resources return when queried. What is documented herein is the v2022 version of the feed, which is based on the v2015 version, the documentation for which is available at the link provided below. The v2022 feed wraps each v2015 resource in a JSON object as that object's data property, alongside a meta property that contains, among other data points, the date and time (UTC) when the resource was last updated. A Revision History document that provides more information on changes between the v2015 and v2022 versions of the feed may be downloaded from [here](/externaldocs/NBA%20Mobile%20Stats%20Feed%20Revision%20History.pdf). An Excel spreadsheet that provides descriptions of the event and action type values that appear in play-by-play events, along with definitions of the Option1, Option2, Option3, and Option4 property values, whose meanings are dependent on the event with which they are associated, may be downloaded from [here](/externaldocs/Game%20Event%20-%20Details.xlsx). Legacy v2015 Mobile Stats Feed Documentation available at [NBA Mobile Stats Feed - v2015.pdf](/externaldocs/NBA%20Mobile%20Stats%20Feed%20-%20v2015.pdf) Designed for base path https://data-test.nba.com/data/v2022/json/mobile_teams.
## General Notes
League Identifiers and League Names
League IDLeague NameFull League Name
00nbaNational Basketball Association
10wnbaWomen's National Basketball Association
20gleagueGatorade League
13californiaCalifornia Classic
15vegasLas Vegas Summer League
16utahSLC Summer League

Team Names

Several of the Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) have a team name as part of the path or file name. The team name is the value of the "tn" property in a league's team_info file for a given team, expressed in lowercase and with underscore characters in place of embedded spaces. Following are examples of valid team names.

  • celtics
  • trail_blazers
  • 76ers
© 2022 - NBA Properties, Inc. - All Rights Reserved

updated.description: Date and time (UTC) these data were last updated

htm.description: Game date and time in home team's time zone

vtm.description: Game date and time in visitor team's time zone

etm.description: Game date and time in Eastern time zone

gdtutc.description: Game date in UTC time zone

utctm.description: Game time in UTC time zone

ac.description: City in which arena is located

as.description: State in which arena is located

next.description: URI used to request this resource

p.description: Current period of the game; null, if not yet started

st.description: Game status "1" Not Yet Started; "2" In Progress; "3" Final

lpla.description: The last play (event) recorded when this box score was generated

LastPlay.description: The last play (event) recorded when this box score was generated

wallclk.description: UTC date and time when event occurred

cl.description: Game clock at time of event

locX.description: X coordinate of event; units = tenths-of-feet

locY.description: Y coordinate of event; units = tenths-of-feet

opt1.description: Option 1 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opt2.description: Option 2 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opt3.description: Option 3 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opt4.description: Option 4 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opid.description: Opposing player identifier (e.g., player who was fouled in a foul event)

tid.description: Team identifier of principal player's team

epid.description: Extra person identifier (e.g., ID of official calling a foul)

pts.description: Points scored as a result of the event

status.description: Active ("A") or Inactive ("I") for the game

tt.description: Number of times score was tied

next.description: The URI used to retrieve this resource

wallclk.description: UTC date and time when event occurred

opt3.description: Option 3 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opt4.description: Option 4 qualifier; meaning varies depending on event type (etype) and action type (mtype)

opid.description: Opposing player ID; e.g., player fouled

epid.description: Extra person ID; e.g., official's ID on foul call

ord.description: Order number; may be used to sort events into correct sequence

pts.description: Points scored as a result of the event

next.description: The URI used to retrieve this resource

gdte.description: Game date in Eastern time zone

next.description: The URI used to retrieve this resource

gdte.description: Game date in Eastern time zone

seri.description: Status of matchups between the teams in current season

st.description: Game status "1" Not Yet Started; "2" In Progress; "3" Final

SeriesGameTeam.description: A team in a game of a series

st.description: Game status; 1 = not yet started, 2 = in progess, 3 = final

ConferenceSeries.description: Series within round for a conference

co.description: Series in the round for the conferences

ran.description: Career rank in totals of the stat indicated by the filename

s.description: Status (A/I); A = player active in league; I = player not active in league

data.description: League Leaders for stat and season type

LeagueLeadersForStat.description: League Leaders for Stat Category and Season Type

ran.description: League rank in totals of the stat indicated by the filename

fgm.description: Field goals made (only in fieldgoals file)

fga.description: Field goals attempted (only in fieldgoals file)

fgp.description: Field goal percentage (only in fieldgoals file)

tpm.description: Three pointers made (only in threepointers file)

tpa.description: Three pointers attempted (only in threepointers file)

tpp.description: Three pointer percentage (only in threepointers file)

ftm.description: Free throws made (only in freethrows file)

fta.description: Free throws attempted (only in freethrows file)

ftp.description: Free throw percentage (only in freethrows file)

data.description: League leaders in all stats categories

LeagueLeadersAllStats.description: League Leaders, all stats, averages and totals

st.description: Game status. 1 = not yet started; 2 = in progress; 3 = final

val.description: Points scored during game by player

hcc.description: Home city and country or college

g.description: Game the high was achieved in

avg.description: Statistical Per Game Averages and Ranks

min.description: Statistical Values Per Minute Values and Ranks

ty.description: The per value that is displayed in each val attribute (Per 48 for NBA and DLeague. Per 40 for the WNBA)

items.description: An array of splits belonging to this split group

ng.description: Next Game (not present if there is not one in the given season type)

val.description: Season Value. One entry per season.

spl.description: Season Splits (optional)- By Playoff Round or by Regular Season Team

val.description: Season Value. One entry per season.

spl.description: Season Splits (optional)- By Playoff Round or by Regular Season Team

tseq.description: The sequence number of playing for that team in the regular season. Sort descending to get earliest to latest. Largest number is first. Zero is last/current. (Regular or Pre Season)

oval.description: Opponent Team Statistical Value Per Game

is.description: 1/0 is "game necessary" indicator (1 = necessary and 0 = not)

ppd.description: Only present when ppdst has value of "A"

ptsls.description: Points Leaders for game (only present when game is complete)

is.description: 1/0 is "game necessary" indicator (1 = necessary and 0 = not)

ppd.description: Only present when ppdst has value of "A"

ptsls.description: Points Leaders for game (only present when game is complete)

LeagueSchedulePPDGameData.description: Postponed game data, only present if ppdst shows game has been postponed

stt.description: Status text; PPD, if game is postponed

etm.description: Original game time, Eastern Time Zone
New game time, Eastern Time Zone

do.description: Days out from middle date in either direction.

is.description: 1/0 is "game necessary" indicator (1 = necessary and 0 = not)

ppd.description: Only present when ppdst has value of "A"

ptsls.description: Points Leaders for game (only present when game is complete)

etm.description: Original game time, Eastern Time Zone
New game time, Eastern Time Zone

ppd.description: Only present when ppdst has value of "A"

stt.description: Status text; PPD, if game is postponed

etm.description: Original game time, Eastern Time Zone
New game time, Eastern Time Zone

nightlyLeaders.description: Nightly leaders for each statistical category

status.description: Player's active/inactive status for the game

period.description: The period for which these are the starting players
